text: Two workers, identified as Balu Jawale and Vasant Jawale were trapped in a 40-ft-deep borewell at Phanaswadi in Girgaum, Mumbai, on Sunday. The fire brigade team had to use breathing apparatus, and a rope ladderand harness, to go down the shaft, and an exhaust blower to draw out hazardous gases, before they could attempt to evacuate the workers. They were rushed to Nair Hospital but declared dead before admission. According to the BMC disaster control room, it received a call in the afternoon that two workers had falleninto a borewell .— Photos: Mumbai Fire Brigade & Deepak Salvi
title: Hope and tragedy
